newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shui On says suspension not to hit profit.
newsitem.headline: Shui On says suspension not to hit profit.

text.p: Shui On Construction and Materials Ltd said on Tuesday it is confident that a three-month suspension from tendering for the government Housing Authority's public housing projects imposed on the group will have no adverse effect on its profits and operations.

"The directors believe the forecast profit of the group for the year ending March 31, 1997, as set out in the prospectus issued by the company on January 22, 1997, will be unaffected by the incident and the suspension," it said in a statement.
The suspension was imposed as a result of the contamination of water at two public housing estates in early March, it added.

Shui On also said that given the substantial outstanding contracts on hand, it was confident the incident and suspension would not have any material adverse impact on the overall operations and results of the group in subsequent years.
It had offered to pay reasonable compensation to the residents affected and it considered the compensation will not be significant to the group.
Shui On shares opened unchanged at HK$7.0 in early Tuesday trade after easing HK$0.20 on Monday.
